summary: This is an email exchange regarding a FOIA request from a media company for audio, video, photographic, and other records related to the investigations and cases involving Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. An Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York responds that no such materials have been made public as they are evidence in the ongoing investigation and pending criminal case against Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the pending criminal case (20 Cr. 330) and a prior civil case (15-cv-7433). The FOIA request seeks records related to her, her properties, and associates.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'JE' in the FOIA request. The request seeks records related to him, his victims, witnesses, properties, and associates.

persons.name: Kevina Tidwell
persons.context: Named in the email subject line as the point of contact for the media company making the FOIA request for records related to Epstein and Maxwell.

connections.description: The FOIA request groups them together as subjects of investigation and prosecution, seeking records related to both and their associates.

events.title: Pending Criminal Case Against Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The Assistant U.S. Attorney states that requested materials are evidence in the pending criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20-CR-00330).

events.title: Prior Civil Case Involving Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The FOIA request references a prior civil case, 'v. Ghislaine Maxwell 15-cv-7433 (LAP)', which is noted as not involving 'SONY'.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York confirmed it had not released any audio, video, photographic, or transcript materials related to Epstein/Maxwell as they were evidence in the ongoing investigation and pending criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20-CR-00330).

A media company submitted a broad FOIA request seeking all recorded interviews with victims, witnesses, and relatives, as well as surveillance materials related to Epstein, Maxwell, their properties, and associates.
The correspondence clarifies that a prior civil case against Maxwell (15-cv-7433) did not involve 'SONY', correcting or preempting a potential misconception from the requester.
The document demonstrates the government's position of withholding investigative materials from the public during active prosecution, citing their status as evidence.
